part1.converted_description:
You are given an ALU program called MONAD which checks the validity of a submarine model number. The model number is a 14-digit number consisting only of digits 1 through 9, with no zeros. MONAD uses the ALU to run a series of instructions, each expecting a single digit of the model number. After running all instructions, MONAD will leave a 0 in variable `z` if the model number is valid, and a non-zero value otherwise. Find the largest valid model number.

Input Format:
The input is the ALU program MONAD, which consists of a series of instructions. Each instruction is on a separate line and follows the format `instruction a b`, where `instruction` is one of the six ALU instructions (`inp`, `add`, `mul`, `div`, `mod`, `eql`), and `a` and `b` are placeholders for variables or numbers.

part2.converted_description:
Find the smallest model number accepted by MONAD.

Input Format:
The input is the ALU program MONAD, which consists of a series of instructions. Each instruction is on a separate line and follows the format `instruction a b`, where `instruction` is one of the six ALU instructions (`inp`, `add`, `mul`, `div`, `mod`, `eql`), and `a` and `b` are placeholders for variables or numbers.
